Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and scalability. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure Managed Lustre.
Design the storage architecture, including the placement of Lustre file systems, integration with existing Azure resources, and access patterns.
Obtain necessary approvals and authorizations for deploying Azure Managed Lustre, including budgetary and compliance checks.
Create and configure the Lustre file system in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify storage capacity and performance tiers.
Set up virtual networks, subnets, and Network Security Groups (NSGs) to ensure secure access to the Lustre file system.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access control policies and integrate with Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Perform thorough testing of the Lustre file system, including IOPS, throughput, and latency measurements to ensure it meets performance requirements.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools. Configure alerts for storage capacity, performance metrics, and file system health.
Document the Lustre file system configuration, usage guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures. Share documentation with relevant teams.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Managed Lustre file systems.
Set up backup and recovery mechanisms for the Lustre file system to ensure data resiliency and availability.
Ensure the Lustre file system setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance.
